alert.note: Alert for Anson; Stanly (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 03 at 8:48PM EST until January 04 at 9:27AM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina... Rocky River Near Norwood affecting Anson and Stanly Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Rocky River Near Norwood. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, The river begins to overflow its banks in some areas upstream of the gage site. At 20.0 feet, Minor flood stage. There is significant overflow into adjacent pasture and lowlands. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EST Monday the stage was 21.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 4.7 feet by Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Fri Rocky River Norwood 20.0 21.5 Mon 8 pm EST 10.0 6.8 5.3 5.2 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning by 845 AM EST.
